subject: Programming
title: Java and Write Once Run Anywhere
description: A short lesson to help you apply Java and Write Once Run Anywhere.

hook.text: In the 1990s, every device had a different processor. Code had to be rewritten for each.

buildup.text: Sun Microsystems created Java with one promise: write once, run anywhere.

discovery.text: Java compiled to bytecode that ran on a virtual machine, making it truly portable.

twist.text: The virtual machine added overhead. Java was slower, and developers mocked its verbosity.

climax.text: Despite the jokes, Java became the backbone of Android, banks, and enterprise systems.

punchline.text: The mocked language powers billions of devices.

quiz.question: What made Java portable across different hardware?
options: It compiled to bytecode for a virtual machine
It was interpreted line by line
